required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Clinical Efficacy of a Dentifrice Containing 5% Fluoro Calcium Phosphosilicate to a Dentifrice Containing Calcium Sodium Phosphosilicate on Dentinal Hypersensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Clinical Efficacy of a Dentifrice Containing 5% Fluoro Calcium Phosphosilicate to a Dentifrice Containing Calcium Sodium Phosphosilicate and to a Placebo on Dentinal Hypersensitivity : a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Government Dental College and Research Institute, Bangalore

clinical_study.source: Government Dental College and Research Institute, Bangalore

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of this study was to assess and compare the efficacy of a dentifrice containing 5% fluoro calcium phosphosilicate and dentifrice containing calcium sodium phosphosilicate on Dentinal Hypersensitivity (DH) compared to a placebo over a period of 6 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 131 subjects were divided into 3 groups randomly. Group I was given the dentifrice containing 5% fluoro calcium phosphosilicate ,Group II was given the dentifrice containing calcium sodium phosphosilicate and group III was given placebo. Sensitivity scores (VAS score) were recorded at baseline, 2 weeks, 6 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Visual Analogue Scale score for Dentinal Hypersensitivity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in VAS score from Baseline to 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Based on a 10-cm VAS score which was used to measure tooth sensitivity, a pain-free response was allotted a score of zero whereas a score of 10 was given to subjects with excruciating pain or discomfort.

arm_group.description: dentifrice containing 5% fluorocalcium phospho silicate prescribed and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 2 weeks, 6 weeks.
dentifrice containing Calcium sodium phosphosilicate prescribed and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 2weeks, 6 weeks .
dentifrice without the active ingredient prescribed and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 2weeks, 6 weeks.

intervention.description: dentifrice containing 5% fluorocalcium phosphosilicate and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 2 weeks, 6 weeks.
Calcium sodium phosphosilicatand VAS score assessed at Baseline, 2weeks, 6 weeks.
placebo dentifrice and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 2weeks, 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The volunteers selected at baseline were in good general health and should have at least 20 natural permanent teeth and history of hypersensitivity to hot, cold, sour stimuli on at least two teeth with a VAS score of â‰¥4.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with active cervical caries or deep abrasion requiring cervical filling, chipped teeth or fractured cusps, tender tooth in same quadrant as the hypersensitive teeth, Subjects using any type of desensitizing paste or desensitizing therapy for last 6 months, Pregnant/ lactating women or subjects with history of chronic use of anti-inflammatory and analgesic medications were excluded.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Government Dental College and Research Institute, Bangalore
